pageContext.claim: “And frankly, you know, we talked to Honduras. We said, we're paying you millions and millions of dollars in aid, in one case, $300 million, that's a lot of money, by the way, and we're giving aid to these countries, and they're allowing this to happen, and we said we're not going to let you do this. And it stopped. El Salvador also, it stopped.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is complaining about a caravan of Central American migrants that originated in Honduras. That country received roughly $300 million in aid from the U.S. over three fiscal years, and the number dropped sharply in fiscal 2018, to $15 million. The State Department has not confirmed that the aid will be stopping.
